intro: Euphrasia bella, commonly known as the pretty willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are small, bell-shaped, and come in shades of yellow to orange, often with dark markings. Euphrasia bella is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in clusters along the ground.
